intro: Pseudobaeckea squalida, commonly known as the rough-leaved pseudobaeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Pseudobaeckea squalida is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
